Key Match Events: Malik Beasley had 20 points, including seven in the fourth quarter, as the Detroit Pistons held off the Toronto Raptors 99-95.
Cade Cunningham and Tobias Harris had double-doubles for the Pistons. Cunningham finished with 15 points and 10 assists, while Harris had 11 points and 11 rebounds.
Jakob Poeltl had a double-double with 25 points and matched a career-high with 19 rebounds for the Raptors.
RJ Barrett scored 22 points and had seven assists and six rebounds.
Gradey Dick had 16 points and five rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Toronto scored six consecutive points in the final two minutes to make it a one-possession game with 15.3 seconds left.
Ochai Agbaji fouled Jaden Ivey, who made one of two free throws for a three-point Pistons lead.
Gradey Dick missed a three-pointer after a Toronto timeout with 9.1 seconds left, and Detroit's Jalen Duren made one of two free throws to finish the game.
Both teams played tight defense, with Toronto having 15 turnovers and Detroit 14.
The Raptors stayed out of foul trouble, only giving out 13 personal fouls.
Others: The Raptors visit the Boston Celtics on Saturday night.
Detroit travels to Washington, D.C., to take on the Wizards on Sunday.
